Emotional Factors

Emotional factors also play a significant role in the perpetuation of flat Earth

theories. Proponents often experience strong emotions, such as anger and

frustration, when confronted with contradictory evidence (The Psychology of

Flat Earthers). This emotional investment can make it difficult for them to

consider alternative perspectives.
